cluster_relations.rel_desc: The properties of black holes characterize what black holes are like.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject provides a description, account, or characterization of the object (typically a phenomenon or entity).

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Includes: formation-related features and observable effects

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Classical general relativity describes the black hole singularity as a point of infinite density and curvature.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject (typically a theory or model) describes or represents the object as having certain specified properties or nature.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: DescriptionDetails: point of infinite density and curvature

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The description of black holes is an account or model that characterizes black holes.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject provides a description, account, or characterization of the object (typically a phenomenon or entity).

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: CompletenessAspect: degree of completeness of description

remarks: This relation is somewhat intrinsic to the 'description of black holes' entity but kept to anchor later relations.
This relation is somewhat intrinsic to the 'description of black holes' entity but kept to anchor later relations.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Subject (typically a theory, model, or description) provides an account or characterization of the object and/or its properties.
args.justification: The predicate "describes_as" is a trivial variant of "describes" and expresses the same core representation semantics (a theory or model describing the nature/properties of an entity). To keep the KG schema consistent and avoid unnecessary predicate variants, this relation should use the same canonical_rel_name as the other description/characterization relations in this cluster.
args.remark: Normalized from 'describes_as' to 'describes' to align with other representation relations that connect descriptive accounts or theories to black hole entities.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Subject (typically a theory, model, or description) provides an account or characterization of the object and/or its properties.
executed_decisions.justification: The predicate "describes_as" is a trivial variant of "describes" and expresses the same core representation semantics (a theory or model describing the nature/properties of an entity). To keep the KG schema consistent and avoid unnecessary predicate variants, this relation should use the same canonical_rel_name as the other description/characterization relations in this cluster.
executed_decisions.remark: Normalized from 'describes_as' to 'describes' to align with other representation relations that connect descriptive accounts or theories to black hole entities.
